article:
in the bottom right corner]] The '[[PokÃ©mon]]' franchise includes over 650
 species of the title characters. PokÃ©mon can be organized according to a number
 of different attributes. The list provides their English names and several
 formats of the Japanese names.

PokÃ©mon can also be divided by the "generation" of games in which they were
introduced and sorted by the other numbering systems introduced in those games.
The first 151 PokÃ©mon, introduced in ''PokÃ©mon Red'' and ''Blue'', have Kanto
PokÃ©dex numbers (official as of those gamesâ remakes), which are the same as the
first 151 National PokÃ©dex numbers. Another 100 PokÃ©mon appeared in ''PokÃ©mon
Gold'' and ''Silver'' to expand the list to 251 for the Johto regional PokÃ©dex
(to which 5 evolutions were added when the games were remade). The Hoenn
regional PokÃ©dex included 67 of these, alongside 135 new species that debuted in
''PokÃ©mon Ruby'' and ''Sapphire'', bringing the total to 386. Next, the fourth
generation combined 81 (in ''PokÃ©mon Diamond'' and ''Pearl) or 100 (in [[PokÃ©mon
Platinum]]) of the 107 new creatures from ''PokÃ©mon Diamond'' and ''Pearl'' with
70 or 110, respectively, of the previous ones to form the regional PokÃ©dex of
Sinnoh. This was the first time not all of the newly introduced PokÃ©mon were
included in the games' regional PokÃ©dex. ''PokÃ©mon Black'' and ''White''
introduced 156 all-new creatures, which made up the entirety of those titles'
Unova PokÃ©dex. This leaves the grand total standing at 649. In the sequel
''PokÃ©mon Black 2'' and ''White 2'', the Unova PokÃ©dex was heavily modified, 145
species from previous entries were added and arranged into the original Unova
PokÃ©dex, bringing it to 301 species, though the grand total currently remained
unchanged. In the lead-up to Generation VI, 25 new PokÃ©mon have been unveiled;
there is an unknown number of new PokÃ©mon still to be revealed.

PokÃ©mon may also be grouped into "families" of the PokÃ©mon (eggs/fossils, for
example) they evolve (or hatch or revive) from and into.

The PokÃ©mon Rangers of Fiore, Almia and Oblivia use PokÃ©dex-like devices called
"Ranger Browsers", but their
numbering systems are not currently included here.
